PyISY Library¶

ISY Class¶

class PyISY.ISY(address, port, username, password, use_https=False, log=None)[source]¶

This is the main class that handles interaction with the ISY device.

address: String of the IP address of the ISY device
port: String of the port over which the ISY is serving its API
username: String of the administrator username for the ISY
password: String of the administrator password for the ISY
use_https: [optional] Boolean of whether secured HTTP should be used
log: [optional] Log file class from logging module
Variables:
  • auto_reconnect – Boolean value that indicates if the class should auto-reconnect to the event stream if the connection is lost.
  • auto_update – Boolean value that controls the class’s subscription to the event stream that allows node, program, and climate values to be updated automatically.
  • climate – Climate manager that holds all climate properties from the controller if the climate module is installed on the controller.
  • connected – Read only boolean value indicating if the class is connected to the controller.
  • log – Logger used by the class and its children.
  • nodes – Nodes manager that interacts with Insteon nodes and groups.
  • programs – Program manager that interacts with ISY programs and i folders.
  • variables – Variable manager that interacts with ISY variables.
__del__()[source]¶

Turns off auto updating when the class is deleted.

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

sendX10(address, cmd)[source]¶

Sends an X10 command.

address: String of X10 device address (Ex: A10) cmd: String of command to execute. Any key of x10_commands can be used

x10_commands = {'dim': 15, 'all_off': 1, 'on': 3, 'off': 11, 'bright': 7, 'all_on': 4}¶

Dictionary of X10 commands.

Node Manager Class¶

class PyISY.Nodes.Nodes(parent, root=None, nids=None, nnames=None, nparents=None, nobjs=None, ntypes=None, xml=None)[source]¶

This class handles the ISY nodes. This class can be used as a dictionary to navigate through the controller’s structure to objects of type Node and Group that represent objects on the controller.

parent: ISY class
root: [optional] String representing the current navigation level’s ID
nids: [optional] list of node ids
nnames: [optional] list of node names
nparents: [optional] list of node parents
nobjs: [optional] list of node objects
ntypes: [optional] list of node types
xml: [optional] String of xml data containing the configuration data
Variables:
  • allLowerNodes – Returns all nodes beneath current level
  • children – A list of the object’s children.
  • hasChildren – Indicates if object has children
  • name – The name of the current folder in navigation.
__getitem__(val)[source]¶

Used for navigating through the node tree. Can take names or IDs.

__iter__()[source]¶

Returns an iterator for each node below the current navigation level.

__repr__()[source]¶

Creates a pretty representation of the nodes/folders/groups.

__reversed__()[source]¶

Returns the iterator in reverse order.

__str__()[source]¶

Returns string representation of the nodes/folders/groups.

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

getByID(nid)[source]¶

Gets object with the given ID.

nid: Integer representing node/group/folder id.
getByInd(i)[source]¶

Returns the object at the given index in the list.

i: Integer representing index of node/group/folder.
getByName(val)[source]¶

Gets child object with the given name.

val: String representing name to look for.
insert(nid, nname, nparent, nobj, ntype)[source]¶

Inserts a new node into the lists.

nid: node id
nname: node name
nparent: node parent
nobj: node object
ntype: node type
parse(xml)[source]¶

Parses the xml data.

xml: String of the xml data
update(waitTime=0)[source]¶

Updates the contents of the class

waitTime: [optional] Amount of seconds to wait before updating

Node Class¶

class PyISY.Nodes.Node(parent, nid, nval, name, dimmable=True)[source]¶

This class handles ISY nodes.

parent: The node manager object.
nid: The Node ID.
nval: The current Node value.
name: The node name.
[optional] dimmable: Default True. Boolean of whether the node is dimmable.
Variables:
  • status – A watched property that indicates the current status of the node.
  • hasChildren – Property indicating that there are no more children.
__str__()[source]¶

Returns a string representation of the node.

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

bright()[source]¶

Brightens the node by one step.

dim()[source]¶

Dims the node by one step.

fastoff()[source]¶

Turns the node fast off.

faston()[source]¶

Turns the node fast on.

off()[source]¶

Turns the node off.

on(val=None)[source]¶

Turns the node on.

[optional] val: The value brightness value (0-255) to set the node to
update(waitTime=0, hint=None)[source]¶

Update the value of the node from the controller.

Group Class¶

class PyISY.Nodes.Group(parent, nid, name, members=[])[source]¶

This class interacts with ISY groups (scenes).

parent: The node manager object.
nid: The node ID.
name: The node name.
members: List of the members in this group.
Variables:
  • dimmable – Boolean value idicating that this group cannot be dimmed.
  • hasChildren – Boolean value indicating that this group has no children.
  • members – List of the members of this group.
  • name – The name of this group.
  • status – Watched property indicating the status of the group.
__del__()[source]¶

Cleanup event handlers before deleting.

__str__()[source]¶

Return a string representation for this group.

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

off()[source]¶

Turns off all the nodes in a scene.

on()[source]¶

Turns on all the nodes in the scene to the set values.

update(e=None)[source]¶

Update the group with values from the controller.

Program Manager Class¶

class PyISY.Programs.Programs(parent, root=None, pids=None, pnames=None, pparents=None, pobjs=None, ptypes=None, xml=None)[source]¶

This class handles the ISY programs.This class can be used as a dictionary to navigate through the controller’s structure to objects of type Program and Folder (when requested) that represent objects on the controller.

parent: The ISY device class
root: Program/Folder ID representing the current level of navigation.
pids: List of program and folder IDs.
pnames: List of the program and folder names.
pparents: List of the program and folder parent IDs.
pobjs: List of program and folder objects.
ptypes: List of the program and folder types.
xml: XML string from the controller detailing the programs and folders.
Variables:
  • allLowerPrograms – A list of all programs below the current navigation level. Does not return folders.
  • children – A list of the children immediately below the current navigation level.
  • leaf – The child object representing the current item in navigation. This is useful for getting a folder to act as a program.
  • name – The name of the program at the current level of navigation.
__getitem__(val)[source]¶

Navigate through the hierarchy using names or IDs.

val: Name or ID to navigate to.
__iter__()[source]¶

Returns an iterator that iterates through all the programs (not folders) that are beneath the current folder in navigation.

__repr__()[source]¶

Returns a string showing the hierarchy of the program manager.

__reversed__()[source]¶

Returns an iterator that goes in reverse order.

__str__()[source]¶

Returns a string representation of the program manager.

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

getByID(pid)[source]¶

Get a program/folder with the given ID.

pid: The program/folder ID to look for.
getByInd(i)[source]¶

Get the program/folder at the given index.

i: The program/folder index.
getByName(val)[source]¶

Get a child program/folder with the given name.

val: The name of the child program/folder to look for.
insert(pid, pname, pparent, pobj, ptype)[source]¶

Insert a new program or folder into the manager.

pid: The ID of the program or folder.
pname: The name of the program or folder.
pparent: The parent of the program or folder.
pobj: The object representing the program or folder.
ptype: The type of the item being added (program/folder).
parse(xml)[source]¶

Parses the XML from the controller and updates the state of the manager.

xml: XML string from the controller.

update(waitTime=0, pid=None)[source]¶

Update the status of the programs and folders.

waitTime: How long to wait before updating.
pid: The program ID to update.

Folder Class¶

class PyISY.Programs.Folder(parent, pid, pname, pstatus)[source]¶

Object representing a program folder on the ISY device.

parent: The folder manager object.
pid: The folder ID.
pname: The folder name.
pstatus: The current folder status.
Variables:
  • dtype – Returns the type of the object (folder).
  • status – Watched property representing the current status of the folder.
__str__()[source]¶

Returns a string representation of the folder.

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

run()[source]¶

Runs the appropriate clause of the object.

runElse()[source]¶

Runs the ELSE clause of the object.

runThen()[source]¶

Runs the THEN clause of the object.

stop()[source]¶

Stops the object if it is running.

update(waitTime=0, data=None)[source]¶

Updates the status of the program.

data: [optional] The data to update the folder with.
waitTime: [optional] Seconds to wait before updating.

Program Class¶

class PyISY.Programs.Program(parent, pid, pname, pstatus, plastup, plastrun, plastfin, penabled, pstartrun, prunning)[source]¶

Class representing a program on the ISY controller.

parent: The program manager object.
pid: The ID of the program.
pname: The name of the program.
pstatus: The current status of the program.
plastup: The last time the program was updated.
plastrun: The last time the program was run.
plastfin: The last time the program finished running.
penabled: Boolean value showing if the program is enabled on the controller.
pstartrun: Boolean value showing if the if the program runs on controller start up.
prunning: Boolean value showing if the current program is running on the controller.
Variables:
  • name – The name of the program.
  • status – Watched property representing the current status of the program.
  • lastUpdate – Watched property representing the last time the program was updated.
  • lastRun – Watched property representing the last time the program was run.
  • lastFinished – Watched property representing the last time the program finished running.
  • enabled – Watched property representing if the program is enabled on the controller.
  • runAtStartup – Watched property representing the if the program runs on controller start up.
  • running – Watched property representing if the current program is running on the controller.
__str__()[source]¶

Returns a string representation of the object.

disable()[source]¶

Disable the program on the controller.

disableRunAtStartup()[source]¶

Disable running the program on controller start up.

enable()[source]¶

Enable the program on the controller.

enableRunAtStartup()[source]¶

Enable running the program on controller start up.

update(waitTime=0, data=None)[source]¶

Update the program with values on the controller.

waitTime: [optional] Seconds to wait before updating.
data: [optional] Data to update the object with.

Variable Manager Class¶

class PyISY.Variables.Variables(parent, root=None, vids=None, vnames=None, vobjs=None, vtypes=None, xml=None)[source]¶

This class handles the ISY variables. This class can be used as a dictionary to navigate through the controller’s structure to objects of type Variable that represent objects on the controller.

parent: The ISY object.
root: The ID of the current level of navigation.
vids: List of variable IDs from the controller.
vnames: List of variable names form the controller.
vobjs: List of variable objects.
vtypes: List of variable types.
xml: XML string from the controller detailing the device’s variables.
Variables:children – List of the children below the current level of navigation.
__getitem__(val)[source]¶

Navigate through the variables by ID or name.

val: Name or ID for navigation.
__repr__()[source]¶

Returns a string representing the children variables.

__str__()[source]¶

Returns a string representation of the variable manager.

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

parse(xmls)[source]¶

Parse XML from the controller with details about the variables.

update(waitTime=0)[source]¶

Update the variable objects with data from the controller.

waitTime: Seconds to wait before updating.

Variable Class¶

class PyISY.Variables.Variable(parent, vid, vtype, init, val, ts)[source]¶

Object representing a variable on the controller.

parent: The variable manager object.
vid: List of variable IDs.
vtype: List of variable types.
init: List of values that variables initialize to when the controller starts.
val: The current variable value.
ts: The timestamp for the last time the variable was edited.
Variables:
  • init – Watched property that represents the value the variable initializes to when the controller boots.
  • lastEdit – Watched property that indicates the last time the variable was edited.
  • val – Watched property that represents the value of the variable.
__repr__()[source]¶

Returns a string representation of the variable.

__str__()[source]¶

Returns a string representation of the variable.

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

setInit(val)[source]¶

Sets the initial value for the variable after the controller boots.

val: The value to have the variable initialize to.
setValue(val)[source]¶

Sets the value of the variable.

val: The value to set the variable to.
update(waitTime=0)[source]¶

Updates the object with the variable’s parameters from the controller.

waitTime: Seconds to wait before updating.

Climate Class¶

class PyISY.Climate.Climate(parent, xml=None)[source]¶

This class handles the ISY climate module.

parent: ISY class
xml: String of xml data containing the climate data
Variables:
  • Gust_Speed – Watched Variable representing the gust speed.
  • Temperature – Watched Variable representing the temperature.
  • Temperature_Rate – Watched Variable representing the temperature rate.
  • Rain_Rate – Watched Variable representing the rain rate.
  • Max_Rain_Rate – Watched Variable representing the rain rate.
  • Temperature_High – Watched Variable representing the high temperature.
  • Pressure_Rate – Watched variable representing the pressure rate.
  • Wind_Speed – Watched Variable representing the wind speed.
  • Elevation – Watched Variable representing the elevation.
  • Dew_Point – Watched Variable representing the dew point.
  • Wind_Average_Speed – Watched Variable representing the avg wind speed.
  • Pressure – Watched Variable representing the pressure.
  • Gust_Direction – Watched Variable representing the gust direction.
  • Wind_Average_Direction – Watched Variable representing the average wind direction.
  • Light – Watched Variable representing the amount of light.
  • Wind_Direction – Watched Variable representing the wind direction.
  • Humidity – Watched Variable representing the humidity.
  • Humidity_Rate – Watched Variable representing the humidity rate.
  • Rain_Today – Watched Variable representing the forcast rain today.
  • Light_Rate – Watched Variable representing the light rate.
  • Water_Deficit_Yesterday – Watched Variable representing the water deficit yesterday.
  • Irrigation_Requirement – Watched Variable representing the irrigation requirement.
  • Feels_Like – Watched Variable representing the feels like temperature.
  • Temperature_Low – Watched Variable representing the low temperature.
  • Evapotranspiration – Watched Variable representing the evapotranspiration amount.
  • Gust_Speed_units – Gust speed units.
  • Temperature_units – Temperature units.
  • Temperature_Rate_units – Temperature rate units.
  • Rain_Rate_units – Rain rate units.
  • Max_Rain_Rate_units – Max rain rate units.
  • Temperature_High_units – High temperature units.
  • Pressure_Rate_units – Pressure rate units.
  • Wind_Speed_units – Wind speed units.
  • Elevation_units – Elevation units.
  • Dew_Point_units – Dew point units.
  • Wind_Average_Speed_units – Average wind speed units.
  • Pressure_units – Pressure units.
  • Gust_Direction_units – Gust direction units.
  • Wind_Average_Direction_units – Average wind direction units.
  • Light_units – Light amount units.
  • Wind_Direction_units – Wind direction units.
  • Humidity_units – Humidity units.
  • Humidity_Rate_units – Humidity rate units.
  • Rain_Today_units – Rain forecast units.
  • Light_Rate_units – Light rate units.
  • Water_Deficit_Yesterday_units – Water deficit units.
  • Irrigation_Requirement_units – Irrigation requirement units.
  • Feels_Like_units – Feels like temperature units.
  • Temperature_Low_units – Low temperature units.
  • Evapotranspiration_units – Evapotranspiration units.
__repr__()[source]¶

Returns a long string showing all the climate values.

__str__()[source]¶

Returns a string representing the climate manager.

__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

parse(xml)[source]¶

Parses the xml data.

xml: String of the xml data

update(waitTime=0)[source]¶

Updates the contents of the climate class

waitTime: [optional] Amount of seconds to wait before updating
